image.altText: A mass of protesters carrying signs that say "guilty".

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has been found guilty on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records in his New York criminal trial relating to "hush money" payments paid to adult film star Stormy Daniels. Follow live.

title.children: Trump lashes out after being found guilty on 34 counts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump's attorney says they will keep fighting and 'it's not over'
PM Anthony Albanese reacts to Trump verdict
When will Donald Trump be sentenced?

image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

props.synopsis: A newly released report shows Australia's icebreaker, the RSV Nuyina, is facing a $100 million cost blowout by 2030 due to rising crew, fuel and maintenance costs.

title.children: Crewing and maintenance costs, fuel consumption leaves troubled vessel facing $100m cost blowout

image.altText: An aerial shot of a waterway and a small town.

props.synopsis: Vincent Edward Down was last seen in 1969. A coroner has now handed down findings into his death.

title.children: 'I may have washed out the back of the ute': Murder suspect made late-night admission at police officer's home

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court in a suit and red tie looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Forced to endure five weeks of painstaking testimony inside a drab Manhattan courthouse, a dozen New Yorkers were drawn into a House-of-Cards world of scandal, skulduggery and sex.

title.children: 'Would have been better left unsaid': Trump's conviction followed a trial about scandal, skulduggery and sex

image.altText: A row of white electric vehicles lined up in a showroom.

props.synopsis: The rapid rise of Chinese electric vehicles has been met with resistance in the US and Europe. So why are Australians buying them at record levels?

title.children: Why Chinese-made cars are becoming so common on Australia's roads

image.altText: Ged Kearney wearing a bright red jacket, sitting at her desk with a nurse union flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Doctors and midwives say Medicare rebates are rife with sexism, with some larger for faster and less complex procedures for men.

title.children: Medicare to be audited for sexism in rebates, starting with ultrasounds and contraception

image.altText: A woman and a man stand in a paddock next to a river in front of three horses.

props.synopsis: Horse owners aren't trying to "limit anyone's fun", but are calling for more neighbourly consideration at next year's cracker night in lieu of the difficulties faced by law enforcement.

title.children: 'Potentially deadly' cracker night a yearly event that owners fear will send their horses into a frenzy

image.altText: Chrystal blue waters and swimmers.

props.synopsis: They're home to subtropical beaches that city slickers dream of, but an emerging trend shows some regional movers are moving away again from Australia's most popular regional cities after arrival.

title.children: Growing pains turn movers away from popular coastal cities as 'the dream is not always what they presume'

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump speaking with pursed lips

props.synopsis: Donald Trump may have been found guilty on all counts for illegally covering up a hush money payment, but the verdict will not prevent the former president from pursuing his campaign to retake the White House.

title.children: Will Donald Trump go to jail? Can he still be president? Here's what happens next

image.altText: Donald Trump in court

props.synopsis: The jury in Donald Trump's "hush money" trial finds the former president guilty of 34 counts of falsifying business records, a felony that could result in prison time.

title.children: Donald Trump becomes first US president to be found guilty of a crime

image.altText: A close-up of a little girl sitting on a hospital bed with her arm bandaged and clutching a panda bear.

props.synopsis: Ten-year-old Lama was dressed and her bag packed to escape Gaza after seven months of war when Israel invaded Rafah and closed the only crossing out of the enclave.

title.children: Ten-year-old Lama was moments away from fleeing Rafah. Then tanks arrived on her doorstep

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him.

props.synopsis: An international syndicate that uses a Pokémon avatar claims to be behind a major Ticketmaster cyber attack, and it's not the first time the group has taken aim at high-profile companies with vast customer databases.

title.children: The 'remarkably devious' ShinyHunters hackers allegedly behind the Ticketmaster data leak

image.altText: A composite image of a skull, air balloon, and a close-up of an octopus eye.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The revelations of a 4,000-year-old skull, an alarming balloon drop, and an underwater friendship

image.altText: Aircraft flying against blue sky.

props.synopsis: Perth Airport's split terminals will be consolidated into one complex, ending years of confusion for travellers, following a new deal struck with Qantas.

title.children: Perth Airport terminals to be consolidated into one complex, in new Qantas deal

image.altText: Two men in suits stand at lecterns for a press conference.

props.synopsis: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has told Anthony Albanese it's concerning the government intends to rewrite 'direction 99' rules that will lead to more Kiwis convicted of crimes in Australia being deported to NZ.

title.children: New Zealand PM calls Albanese to state displeasure over 'direction 99' criminal deportation change

image.altText: A woman with short, curly ,red hair in a floral dress posing behind an orange tiled bar.

props.synopsis: Self-professed “over-achiever” Olivia Franklin shares what she has learnt after being forced to move on from failed dream, and the more than $100,000 worth of debt that has come with it.

title.children: Olivia's small business failed and she's finding ways to deal with the financial impact

image.altText: A man in his 50's in a white polo shirt, standing against trees

props.synopsis: The mayor has apologised to veterans and the Australian Defence Force, saying he wasn't able to recall details of his service history due to medical reasons.

title.children: Townsville mayor admits details of his military and academic history were false

image.altText: Woman smiling

props.synopsis: A former Supreme Court judge says Kiama Council's "poorly executed attempt" to censure a councillor over an ABC interview appears to have been an attempt to suppress a rational opinion.

title.children: 'Designed to shut her up': Former judge accuses council of attempt to silence dissenting voice

image.altText: A dark sky with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A 5,000-kilometre-long cloud band travelling west to east is expected to drench parts of the country over the coming days. Following a second rainband, a separate weather system is threatening to bring heavy rain from NSW to Tasmania from Saturday to Thursday.

title.children: Three weather systems combine for an ongoing Australia-wide soaking

image.altText: Actor Jack Black smiling and holding up rock hand signs.

props.synopsis: Hollywood star Jack Black has responded to an invitation from students from Ringwood Secondary College in Melbourne to visit their production of School of Rock, based on the actor's 2003 film..

title.children: Jack Black responds to Melbourne highschoolers' heartfelt plea to visit School of Rock production

props.synopsis: Four people are arrested and more than 2,000 internet domains across the globe are seized as part of an international crackdown on cybercrime, with police warning more action is to come.

title.children: International raids take down ransomware networks across globe

image.altText: A list ranking school students in offensive categories.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Department of Education is investigating a social media post that ranks female students from a Gold Coast secondary school into disturbing sexist categories.

title.children: Investigation underway into 'vile' post ranking female students at Gold Coast school

image.altText: Guzman Y Gomez  Quesadillas Jack Cheese

props.synopsis: The local share market is trading higher on Friday after recording losses earlier in the week, while fast-food chain Guzman y Gomez has announced plans to list on the ASX next month. Follow live.

title.children: Guzman y Gomez announces IPO and ASX listing, share market rises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 📺 Australia is missing out on billions in royalties from gas projects
Guzman y Gomez to IPO in June
What happens to US Federal Reserve boss if Trump becomes President?

image.altText: Tatiana Weston-Webb celebrates her perfect 10 in Tahiti.

props.synopsis: Tatiana Weston-Webb may not have won the Tahiti Pro, but her history-making performance at Teahupo'o has left the Brazilian beaming with pride.

title.children: 'What a moment for women's surfing': Tatiana Weston-Webb reacts to historic perfect 10 in Tahiti

image.altText: A man's hand holding a bottle of beer.

props.synopsis: Advocates and MPs say the government must stand up to the alcohol lobby if it's serious about stopping violence against women and children.

title.children: Should late home delivery of alcohol be banned to help bring down rates of violence against women?

image.altText: A composite image of bare rocks and eaten grass, alongside tussocks of green grass.

props.synopsis: It's been 10 years since Macquarie Island was declared pest free. Scientists say the transformation of the World Heritage-listed area has been extraordinary, but new threats are on the horizon.

title.children: 'Absolutely extraordinary': 10 years after 'ambitious' eradication program, Macquarie Island remains pest free

image.altText: Tasmanian Archbishop Julian Porteous at his installation ceremony in Hobart.

props.synopsis: A Catholic school rebukes the archbishop of Hobart after Julian Porteous earlier this month railed against "woke" culture, same-sex marriage and abortion rights.

title.children: Catholic school says it will remain 'safe, respectful and inclusive' in retort to archbishop's controversial letter

image.altText: GreenieCyber3

props.synopsis: A senior Australian official has travelled to Taiwan for high-level talks on countering Chinese cyber threats, amid growing pushback from Beijing against any diplomatic contact with the democratic island.

title.children: Senior Australian security official travels to Taiwan amid diplomatic tensions with China

image.altText: Four people stand around a video game installation looking down at the screen

props.synopsis: The Freeplay Independent Games Festival is celebrating its 20th year of hosting the who's who of gaming in Melbourne. Organisers say keeping independence and creativity in games is more important than ever.

title.children: 'I didn't know video games could be like this': How Freeplay champions gaming like a writers' festival

image.altText: a woman stands in between rows of winegrapes draped in white nets

props.synopsis: The gender pay gap and female participation in the wine industry are still wide despite a report showing progress for women.

title.children: Dial slowly moving for female participation in wine

image.altText: Nelly Korda tilts her head standing with her caddie

props.synopsis: World number one Nelly Korda entered the US Open having won six of her last seven starts. No one could have foreseen the par-3 meltdown that would throw her US Open campaign into disarray.

title.children: Oh, Nelly! World No.1 Korda makes a septuple-bogey 10 in nightmare start to US Women’s Open

image.altText: Alex de Minaur, wearing blue tennis gear, clenches his fist after a point at the French Open.

props.synopsis: Australian number one Alex de Minaur reaches the third round at Roland Garros for the first time in eight attempts, before Thanasi Kokkinakis bounces back from two sets down to win a five-set marathon.

title.children: De Minaur breaks French Open hoodoo and Kokkinakis mounts miracle comeback on another rainy day

image.altText: Army soldier holding a gun

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden will allow Ukraine to use American weaponry to strike back at Russia, but only for the purpose of defending Kharkiv.

title.children: Biden partially lifts ban on Ukraine using US arms in strikes on Russian territory, officials say

image.altText: King Chales in red uniform with tall black fluffy hat covering his eyes as he sits on black horse.

props.synopsis: King Charles will participate in his annual birthday parade next month from a carriage rather than on horseback as he battles cancer, British media reports.

title.children: King Charles to ride in carriage instead of horseback for birthday parade, reports say
